svcsubproc.title: Range Case Service - Conventional Trucks
svcsubproc.para: It is possible to service the range case without removing the entire transmission from the vehicle as follows:

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Air Lines and End Yoke

step1.para: Begin by removing the 1/4" air lines and the end yoke ( Figure 35). Also remove the speedometer gear or spacer from the output bearing cap.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Use Rear Case Support Fixture and Transmission Jack Stand

step1.para: A rear case support fixture and a transmission jack stand will be needed ( Figure 36).

Remove all case bolts except one, which should be on top of the case ( Figure 37). Then secure the bracket to the output shaft using the output washer and nut. Tighten the nut to 550-600 ft. lbs. Use pry bars in the milled slots to help break the seal between case sections.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Detach Range Section From Rest of Unit

step1.para: Detach the range section from the rest of the unit ( Figure 38). Pull the section straight off. It must be level with the rest of the unit.

figure.caption: Figure 40. These Parts Can Be Serviced Without Removing Complete Transmission From Vehicle

step1.para: These parts can be serviced without removing the complete transmission from the vehicle ( Figure 39).
